## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 297, 301, 313]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 278, 905, 333]]<|/det|>
0625/42 February/March 2019 1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 415, 375]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper. No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 408]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 715, 490]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 500, 767, 560]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions. Electronic calculators may be used. You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 568, 759, 599]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 72, 562, 92]]<|/det|>
One isotope of iridium-194 is represented by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[470, 97, 531, 128]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{194}{77}\mathrm{Ir}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 133, 771, 153]]<|/det|>
This isotope decays by \(\beta \)-emission to a stable isotope of platinum (Pt).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 164, 567, 183]]<|/det|>
Complete the nuclide equation for this decay.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[376, 203, 625, 237]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{194}{77}\mathrm{Ir}\rightarrow \dots \dots \mathrm{Pt} + \dots \dots \beta\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 227, 920, 246]]<|/det|>
